Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: The types of data converted to tappable URLs in the editor view.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: contentLength
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Length of content within the Editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: isEditable
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Determines if the EditorView is editable or not.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: isEmpty
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Determines if the editor is empty.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: currentLayoutLine
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Current line information based the caret position or selected range. If the selected range spans across multiple

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: firstLayoutLine
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: First line of content based on layout in the Editor. Nil if editor is empty.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: lastLayoutLine
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Last line of content based on layout in the Editor. Nil if editor is empty.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: selectedText
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Selected text in the editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.name: font
Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.abstract: Default font to be used by the Editor. A font may be overridden on whole or part of content in EditorView by an EditorCommand or

Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.name: paragraphStyle
Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.abstract: Default paragraph style to be used by the Editor. The style may be overridden on whole or part of content in

Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.name: textColor
Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.abstract: Default text color to be used by the Editor. The color may be overridden on whole or part of content in

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: maxHeight
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Maximum height that the EditorView can expand to. After reaching the maximum specified height, the editor becomes scrollable.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: attributedText
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Text to be set in the EditorView

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: enableSelectionHandles
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Determines if the selection handles should be shown when selectedRange is set programatically. Defaults is true.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: selectedRange
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets or sets the selected range in the EditorView.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: typingAttributes
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Typing attributes to be used. Automatically resets when the selection changes.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: boundsObserver
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: An object interested in observing the changes in bounds of the Editor, typically an Attachment.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: contentOffset
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets and sets the content offset.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: linkTextAttributes
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: The attributes to apply to links.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: textEndRange
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Range of end of text in the EditorView. The range has always has length of 0.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: isContainedInAnAttachment
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Determines if the current Editor is contained in an attachment

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: contentName
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Name of the content if the Editor is contained within an Attachment.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: visibleRange
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Returns the visible text range.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: containerAttachment
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Attachment containing the current Editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: nestingLevel
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Nesting level of current Editor within other attachments containing Editors.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: clear()
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Clears the contents in the Editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: autocorrectionType
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: The autocorrection style for the text object.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: allowsEditingTextAttributes
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the text view allows the user to edit style information.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: textDragDelegate
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: A text drag delegate object for customizing the drag source behavior of a text view.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: textDropDelegate
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: The text drop delegate for interacting with a drop activity in the text view.

Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.name: sizeThatFits(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.abstract: Asks the view to calculate and return the size that best fits the specified size.

Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.name: becomeFirstResponder()
Classes/EditorView.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.abstract: Asks UIKit to make this object the first responder in its window.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: contentLinesInRange(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets the lines separated by newline characters from the given range.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: previousContentLine(from:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets the previous line of content from the given location. A content line is defined by the presence of a

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: nextContentLine(from:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets the next line of content from the given location. A content line is defined by the presence of a

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: layoutLineAfter(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets the line preceding the given line. Nil if the given line is invalid or is first line

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: layoutLineBefore(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets the line before the given line. Nil if the given line is invalid or is first line

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: rects(for:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Returns the rectangles for line fragments spanned by the range. Based on the span of the range,

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: caretRect(for:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Returns the caret rectangle for given position in the editor content.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: word(at:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets the word from text at given location in editor content

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: deleteBackward()
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: insertAttachment(in:attachment:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Inserts an Attachment in the EditorView.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: setFocus()
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Sets the focus in the EditorView

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: resignFocus()
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Makes the EditorView lose focus.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: scrollRangeToVisible(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Makes the EditorView scroll to given range such that it is visible. No-op if the range is already visible.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: scrollRectToVisible(_:animated:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Makes the EditorView scroll to given range such that it is visible. No-op if the range is already visible.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: contents(in:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Gets the contents within the Editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: transformContents(in:using:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Transforms EditorContent into given type. This function can also be used to encode content into a different type for e.g. encoding the contents to JSON. Encoding

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: replaceCharacters(in:with:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Replaces the given range of content with the attributedString provided.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: replaceCharacters(in:with:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Replaces the characters in the given range with the string provided.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: appendCharacters(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Appends the given attributed text to the end of content in EditorView.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: appendCharacters(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Appends the given attributed text to the end of content in EditorView.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: registerProcessor(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Registers the given text processor with the editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: unregisterProcessor(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Unregisters the given text processor from the editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: registerProcessors(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Registers the given text processors with the editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: unregisterProcessors(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Unregisters the given text processors from the editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: registerCommands(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Registers the given commands with the Editor. Only registered commands can be executed if any is added to the Editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: unregisterCommands(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Unregisters the given commands from the Editor. When all commands are unregistered, any command can be executed on the editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: registerCommand(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Registers the given command with the Editor. Only registered commands can be executed if any is added to the Editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: unregisterCommand(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Unregisters the given command from the Editor. When all commands are unregistered, any command can be executed on the editor.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: canPerformMenuAction(_:withSender:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Determines if the given menu action can be invoked.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: addAttributes(_:at:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Adds given attributes to the range provided. If the range already contains a value for an attribute being provided,

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: removeAttributes(_:at:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Removes the given attributes from the range provided. If the attribute does not exist in the range, it will be a no-op.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: addAttribute(_:value:at:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Adds given attribute to the range provided. If the attribute already exists in the range, it will be overwritten with the new value provided here.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: removeAttribute(_:at:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Removes the attribute from given range. If the attribute does not exist in the range, it is a no-op.

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: convertToRenderer()
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Creates a RendererView from current EditorView

Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.name: isCommandRegistered(_:)
Classes/EditorView.html#/s:6Proton10Edit.abstract: Determines if the given command can be executed on the current editor. The command is allowed to be executed if

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: selectBeforeDelete
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Governs if the attachment should be selected before being deleted. When true, tapping the backspace key the first time on range containing Attachment will only

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: string
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Attributed string representation of the Attachment. This can be used directly to replace a range of text in EditorView

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: didChangeBounds(_:)
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Causes invalidation of layout of the attachment when the containing view bounds are changed

Classes/Attachment.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.name: bounds
Classes/Attachment.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.abstract: The bounds rectangle, which describes the attachment’s location and size in its own coordinate system.

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: init(_:size:)
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Initializes the attachment with the given content view

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: init(_:size:)
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Initializes the attachment with the given content view

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: offsetProvider
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Offsets for the attachment. Can be used to align attachment with the text. Defaults to .zero

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: removeFromContainer()
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Removes this attachment from the EditorView it is contained in.

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: rangeInContainer()
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Range of this attachment in it’s container

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: addedAttributesOnContainingRange(rangeInContainer:attributes:)
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Invoked when attributes are added in the containing EditorView in the range of string in which this attachment is contained.

Classes/Attachment.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.name: attachmentBounds(for:proposedLineFragment:glyphPosition:characterIndex:)
Classes/Attachment.html#/c:@M@Proton@obj.abstract: Returns the calculated bounds for the attachment based on size rule and content view provided during initialization.

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.name: invalidateLayout()
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:6Proton10Atta.abstract: Invalidates the current layout and triggers a layout update.

Classes/Attachment.html.name: Attachment
Classes/Attachment.html.abstract: An attachment can be used as a container for any view object. Based on the AttachmentSize provided, the attachment automatically renders itself alongside the text in EditorView.

Classes/BackgroundStyle.html.name: BackgroundStyle
Classes/BackgroundStyle.html.abstract: Style for background color attribute. Adding backgroundStyle attribute will add border, background and shadow

Classes/EditorView.html.name: EditorView
Classes/EditorView.html.abstract: A scrollable, multiline text region capable of resizing itself based of the height of the content. Maximum height of EditorView

Classes/EditorViewContext.html.name: EditorViewContext
Classes/EditorViewContext.html.abstract: Describes the context for the EditorView. A context is used to execute the commands using EditorCommandExecutor. In a typical scenario, where there are

Classes/ListCommand.html.name: ListCommand
Classes/ListCommand.html.abstract: Command that can be used to toggle list attributes of selected range of text.

Classes/EditorCommandExecutor.html.name: EditorCommandExecutor
Classes/EditorCommandExecutor.html.abstract: EditorCommandExecutor manages all the EditorView in the main EditorView. Sub editors may have been added as Attachment in the EditorView.

Classes/ListTextProcessor.html.name: ListTextProcessor
Classes/ListTextProcessor.html.abstract: Text process capable of processing keyboard inputs specific to lists. ListTextProcessor only works after a range of text

Classes/RendererView.html.name: RendererView
Classes/RendererView.html.abstract: A scrollable, multiline text region capable of resizing itself based of the height of the content. Maximum height of RendererView

Classes/RendererViewContext.html.name: RendererViewContext
Classes/RendererViewContext.html.abstract: Describes the context for the RendererView. A context is used to execute the commands using RendererCommandExecutor. In a typical scenario, where there are

Classes/RendererCommandExecutor.html.name: RendererCommandExecutor
Classes/RendererCommandExecutor.html.abstract: RendererCommandExecutor manages all the RendererView in the main RendererView. Sub renderers may have been added as Attachment in the RendererView.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
